name: Community Fibre
description:
Fibre optic internet straight to your home!
Light speed downloads! #thedeathofbuffering

jobs.title: Customer Services Representative
jobs.description:
Fibre Optic Internet Startup - Customer Service Representative at Community Fibre in London

We are an insurgent fibre optic internet provider disrupting the telecoms industry! With success comes customers – more and more of them… As such, we’re targeting a 24/7 support model which is a huge task for us. The Customer Service Representative role will require shift work which will be distributed fairly across the service team.

We’ve got a great product, we’ve built our own infrastructure, and we’ve acquired customers that love our service.

We want to ensure that our product’s quality, the meticulousness we build our fibre optic network with, comes into our customer service.

Customer service is not a cost centre here! We are built on the belief that those relationships, when nurtured, grow our business and increase our reputation. Word of mouth, reviews, etc, are extremely powerful.

We don’t want to be as good as the better bunch in the telecoms business, we have set our sights on matching the giants in tech and how beloved they are by their customers.

The number one skill is empathy for this role – the rest can be taught (you’ll learn how WiFi actually works, etc)!

Why not check out some of our customer’s reviews?
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Fibre Optic Internet Startup - Customer Service Representative at Community Fibre in London

We are an insurgent fibre optic internet provider disrupting the telecoms industry! With success comes customers – more and more of them… As such, we’re targeting a 24/7 support model which is a huge task for us. The Customer Service Representative role will require shift work which will be distributed fairly across the service team.

We’ve got a great product, we’ve built our own infrastructure, and we’ve acquired customers that love our service.

We want to ensure that our product’s quality, the meticulousness we build our fibre optic network with, comes into our customer service.

Customer service is not a cost centre here! We are built on the belief that those relationships, when nurtured, grow our business and increase our reputation. Word of mouth, reviews, etc, are extremely powerful.

We don’t want to be as good as the better bunch in the telecoms business, we have set our sights on matching the giants in tech and how beloved they are by their customers.

The number one skill is empathy for this role – the rest can be taught (you’ll learn how WiFi actually works, etc)!

Why not check out some of our customer’s reviews?

jobs.title: Finance Manager
jobs.description:
Company Profile
Community Fibre is a growing start-up which builds and operates an ultrafast broadband network in London, and recently was voted the fastest broadband provider in the UK by Think Broadband. 


We have experienced rapid growth through 2018 and have ambitious plans to double our buildout and number of customers in during 2019.

We want to maintain the best elements of a start-up culture while we grow, and are based in a great collaborative office in London (Wework).

Our key achievements have been:
•	Raised £45m from large institutions (RPMI and Amber Infrastructure)
•	Offering 10GB broadband to business customers and soon residential customers
•	Deployed our full fibre infrastructure to 60,000 premises (homes and businesses) 
•	Agreements with landlords to deploy to 250,000 premises
•	Connected 6,000 customers 

The role
We're looking for an ambitious and driven Finance Manager to join our team. You will be responsible for running the day to day operations of the Finance team, managing three staff. You will be given the autonomy to recommend and implement improvements across finance.  



Responsibilities

•	Manage the transactional finance team, including the following ongoing tasks:
o	Purchase to pay process
o	Develop financial approval processes and track compliance 
o	Cashflow forecasting
o	Payroll and expenses
o	All HMRC related compliance – VAT and tax returns
o	Allocation and tracking of capital expenditure

•	Manage the month end process and reporting:
o	Preparation of monthly management accounts, analysing performance against budget
o	Prepare finance section for investor board reports
o	Responsible for month end timetable and ensuring information is provided in a timely manner 
o	Ownership of monthly cost reporting,  ensuring spend has been allocated correctly
o	Developing a process to reconcile stock at month end 
o	Maintaining up to date financial reconciliations, ensuring timely resolution of reconciling items and constant process improvement 

•	Other:
o	Provide key financial information to the business for operational decisions
o	Ensure integrity of controls, and financial records, and compliance across the business
o	Lead preparation for the annual Audit and Statutory Accounts 
o	Support implementation of new accounting software 
o	Work with Colleagues across the business to identify and implement performance improvements


Experience & attributes
•	Strong academics, graduate (2:1) top 30 or similar, qualified accountant (ACA, ACCA, CIMA)
•	Newly qualified to 2 years PQE experience in Finance Manager role, audit or preparation of management/financial accounts
•	Experience in top 10 audit firm/professional services firm, large corporate or start-up
•	Strong report writing capabilities 
•	Ambitious, keen to get hands on experience in a fast-changing start-up environment
•	Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines
•	Detail oriented and experienced in follow-through and completion of projects
•	Advanced Excel skills
•	Knowledge of Python a bonus, though not essential 
•	Good verbal and written communication skills 
•	Interest in technology industry

o Purchase to pay process

• Manage the month end process and reporting:
o Preparation of monthly management accounts, analysing performance against budget
o Prepare finance section for investor board reports
o Responsible for month end timetable and ensuring information is provided in a timely manner
o Ownership of monthly cost reporting, ensuring spend has been allocated correctly
o Developing a process to reconcile stock at month end
o Maintaining up to date financial reconciliations, ensuring timely resolution of reconciling items and constant process improvement

• Other:
o Provide key financial information to the business for operational decisions
o Ensure integrity of controls, and financial records, and compliance across the business
o Lead preparation for the annual Audit and Statutory Accounts
o Support implementation of new accounting software
o Work with Colleagues across the business to identify and implement performance improvements

• Strong academics, graduate (2:1) top 30 or similar, qualified accountant (ACA, ACCA, CIMA)
• Newly qualified to 2 years PQE experience in Finance Manager role, audit or preparation of management/financial accounts
• Experience in top 10 audit firm/professional services firm, large corporate or start-up
• Strong report writing capabilities
• Ambitious, keen to get hands on experience in a fast-changing start-up environment
• Ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlines
• Detail oriented and experienced in follow-through and completion of projects
• Advanced Excel skills
• Knowledge of Python a bonus, though not essential
• Good verbal and written communication skills
• Interest in technology industry

jobs.title: Marketing Communications Manager
jobs.description:
About Us:
Community Fibre is on a mission to bring “Better Internet to Everyone”, unlike many traditional "fibre broadband" providers where old and slow copper technology is used, Community Fibre install optical fibre cables directly to your home giving you access to “true” fibre broadband.

Since December 2015 our key achievements have been:

●	Raised £40m investment from large institutions
●	Acquired 500,000 wayleaves across Local Authorities, Housing Associations and Private Landlords
●	Deployed our full fibre infrastructure to 50,000 premises 
●	Connected over 5,000 customers 

We are here to disrupt the market and change the rules of the game. Our teams are empowered to take ownership of their work, striving for personal accountability, and rewarded with endless opportunities to develop. Every member of our team plays an integral part of our success. 

Our environment is fast-paced and dynamic. Our Paddington work space is bright and vibrant offering more than a community of start-ups, from a sunny rooftop garden, to creative break out spaces complete with the requisite ping pong tables. 

Job Purpose:	
We are looking for the rule breakers, the straight ‘A’ students with a rebellious streak. We have our eye on the prize but need to rip the rule book up on how we get there!

The Marketing Communications Manager is the centre point for all internal and external communications. As custodian of the brand, it is the responsibility of the Marketing Communications Manager is to apply the company filter to any piece of communication to ensure consistency in tone of voice and look and feel. Furthermore, the Marketing Communications Manager will be responsible for the planning and execution of all communication strategies across the B2C, B2B and B2L businesses.

The position sits as part of the Marketing team, alongside the Head of Marketing. You will be required to work closely with the Head of Marketing and CMO to bring to life the commercial aspects of any promotions across all channels.

Responsibilities:
●	Developing an integrated communications strategy for the company incorporating PR, Marketing and Online.
●	Implementing communications plans to increase brand awareness and recognition for the organisation.
●	Developing relationships with key media to secure and grow media coverage both online and offline.
●	Monitoring press stories relating to the company and its brand and maximising opportunities for positive PR and playing down any negative PR.
●	Collating and analysing current communications and messages and ensuring consistency.
●	Working with relevant agencies, specifically social, PR and creative
●	Developing and leading the company’s internal communication strategy.
●	Communicating brand to internal customers and stakeholders.
●	Overseeing the annual communications budget and ensuring its use is fully maximised.
●	Act as brand custodian ensuring all communications align with guidelines, evolving and developing where necessary
●	Develop and execute the eCRM marketing strategy
●	Work with the Head of Marketing to achieve key metrics highlighted in the annual business plan and reporting on performance
●	Work on ad-hoc projects to help increase conversion


We are an equal opportunities employer that values diversity in our team, we welcome applications from all backgrounds.

jobs.title: Programme Analyst
jobs.description:
Job Description
What we want
This role reports into the COO and is responsible for cohering and optimising our network
infrastructure build. They will work across the operations team, tracking project completion against plan, forecasting future completion dates and working with the senior operations team to ensure that our supply chain is scaled to meet forecast growth. In time, the Programme Coordinator will manage a small team to assist in delivering their responsibilities, which will be recruited for as our business grows and in accordance with the plan developed by the Coordinator.


Responsibilities
● Working with the Wayleaves Acquisition Team to incorporate new projects into our work
programme, and providing the Acquisition Team with anticipated completion dates for new and current projects
● Working with Project Managers to maintain the currency of our programme plan, ensuring
accuracy of status and forecast completions, and providing accurate management information
for the weekly operations meeting
● Providing management information to the Operations Leadership Team (of which they will be
part) to manage the allocation of projects across project teams and contractors
● Working with the Heads of Planning and Network Delivery to provide management information for the purposes of contractor management
● Interfacing with the Finance team to provide reporting that allows PMs to manage project cost
● Planning and monitoring operations material requirements, providing regular forecasts to
suppliers
● Providing the Marketing and Sales team with a clear view of project status for those projects
approaching completion, and when completed, to allow the sequencing of Marketing and Sales


Experience & attributes
 Numerate and analytical
 Comfortable and confident interacting at all levels in our organisation
 Keen to continually increase the value that can be added by the role and their team
 Competent or advanced users of MS Excel and likely to be familiar with project management
software such as MS Project.
 Some familiarity with, or a desire to learn, basic SQL would be beneficial.
 Experience in fibre optic network deployment would be an advantage, but is not a pre-
requisite

jobs.title: Technical Procurement Manager
jobs.description:
Job Description
Technical Procurement Manager
Duties and responsibilities

• Responsible for key strategic supplier selection and contract negotiations relating to the passive network (including network components, accessories etc.). Develop sourcing strategies. 

• Source suppliers – often on an international basis, negotiate and manage contracts and build key relationships with both suppliers and the internal teams. 

• Proactively drive enforcement of strategy, identification and realisation of savings opportunities to create a competitive advantage for the business., and mitigation of supply risks 

• Ensure suppliers forecasts are shared and weekly/monthly capacity plans are created. 

• Supplier governance initiatives and relationship management through regular reviews, visits and supplier audits. Perform supplier business, financial reviews on quarterly performance and strategic business direction. Analyse issues at supply market level and supply chain level 

• Undertake product research including potential suppliers and competitive products. 

• Develop and maintain a robust and centralised system for call offs with each supplier. 

• Working on the tendering process for obtaining goods or services. 

• Working on the policy on waste management. Personal Skills: 

• Negotiation, interpersonal and communication skills are key 

• Strong commercial acumen and financial and analytical skills 

• Be good at building strong internal and external working relationships 

• Be keen and eager to learn new things 

• Passionate about telecommunications
